name: .VID File Extension
summary: Learn about .VID files and view a list of programs that open them.

description: A VID file is a generic video file that has been saved in one of many possible video file formats. Often, the file’s extension has been changed from its original extension to .vid. For example, a user might have renamed a file like clip1.mov to clip1.vid in an attempt to play the video using their preferred media player.

content: Because VID files are now used infrequently, some programs that previously supported opening and playing VID files no longer do so. For example, you can no longer open and play VID files using Apple QuickTime Player, and Microsoft Windows Media Player does not recognize the .vid extension by default.

instructions: You can open and play a VID file with VideoLAN VLC media player, a free-to-download media player. For example, to open a VID file in the Windows version of VLC:
In the window that appears, select All Files from the dropdown menu that appears above the Open button.
Navigate to and open your VID file.
VideoLAN VLC media player can convert VID files to several other video formats, including:

windows.name: Open over 400 file formats with File Viewer Plus.Free Download
